intro: Perideridia bolanderi subsp. bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in a whitish, powdery coating, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The small white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring, attracting various pollinators.
